name: Courtyard Cocoa Beach

reviews.text: This hotel was way above average hotel for it being on the beach. I had a discount for the room so I was very satisfied with this stay. I would of been a little more critical if I would have had to pay full price. The only issue I had was that the air condition had rust on it around where it meets up to the wall and the shower had some molding spots in the corner. The hotel staff was very friendly throughout my 5 day stay and the pool is really good, especially if you have kids. I will stay in this hotel again when I'm back in Cocoa Beach.
reviews.title: Good Beach Hotel
Caring staff, clean, close to beach...
reviews.text: We were in town for a wedding. The staff at this Courtyard are wonderful! From the orientation provided at check-in to the cafe staff to the housekeeping team, they aim to please and do not disappoint. Very clean!! Larger lobby and seating areas than you would expect at a hotel this size, including a cozy outdoor seating area with firepit for the evening. Pool was smaller than expected but we realize people are there to go to the beach, a short walk away. The beach was less crowded than areas further south. If you are looking for a clean and quiet hotel with excellent customer service, this is your place. If you like more of the resort-type hotels, this may not have enough amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know I have reviewed this hotel before, but I have to go on record again to spread the good word about this hotel. Stayed this time for 9 nights, just with my wife - no kids in tow this time. We arrived a couple of hours early, but our room was ready for us. We had requested a Sea View room which they accommodated. The room was excellent, on the 6th floor with a good view of the Cocoa Beach seafront. Rooms had been recently refurbished and the huge king sized bed was really comfortable. All of the staff were excellent - nothing is too much trouble for them. We used the pool area regularly, which was nicely presented and clean. The Bistro was useful for lunchtime snacks, and as before, a special mention must go out to Rita, who is a real treasure, and treats us like family every time we visit. I cannot praise this hotel enough - it was a really nice stay, and made our holiday very special.
reviews.title: First class stay

reviews.text: This was my second stay at this hotel. The lobby is decorated modern. Very nice and clean. Rooms need a little updating, especially the carpets. A little worn and stained. Staff are very friendly. There is a table set up for Internet use and a big seating area in the lobby. Plenty of tables to sit at. They don't have a free breakfast here. Food and drinks are for purchase only. Pool area is nice. Tiki bar is open on Friday and Saturday nights. They have select drinks offered at Happy Hour. Happy Hour is offered inside or outside at the Tiki Bar by the pool. They also have a fire pit in the evenings. Located near the famous Ron Jon Surf Shop. McDonald's is located across the street. There is a grocery store nearby and it's located on the same side of the street as the Beach but not directly on the Beach. Just a short walk to yhe Beach. Every room on the upper floors have a balcony. Coin laundry machines are located on three of the floors and are $2.00 for the washer and $2.00 for the dryer. Detergent is automatically dispensed with a push of a button. They offer transportation to and from the cruise port. I believe it's $10.00 a person for a round trip ride. They also charge a fee to leave your vehicle here if you leave it while you take a cruise. Overall a nice place to stay. I Will definitely recommend and consider returning.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: When you walk into the Courtyard you can tell it was recently updated. The main lobby is very open and welcoming. The young lady who checked us in greeted us promptly and was very friendly. The elevators look a little outdated but we did not encounter any issues. Our room was very spacious. It had one queen bed and a lounge area with a couch and coffee table. The TV was modern as were the decorations in the room. From our balcony we were able to see the beach. The sunrise was stunning! We stayed for just one night before embarking on a 4 day Disney cruise. The hotel was just a few minutes from the port, so the location was ideal. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Recently renovated!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a recently remodeled Courtyard with the open area check-in, information board in the lobby and a nice little restaurant and bar. The rooms are pretty typical of the new Courtyards - comfortable and spacious. What really set this apart for our visit was the service - especially from the bar/restaurant staff. I came down one morning to get breakfast to take back to the room for my wife and I. My hands were full so the restaurant employee walked with me to the elevator, called it and even went in and pressed the button for my floor.
reviews.title: Outstanding service, nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay before your cruise.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but not on the beach

reviews.text: We stayed here for a few nights while visiting friends in Cocoa Beach. The hotel is not on the beach, there is a walk from the hotel down to beach access. The hotel was very nice, rooms were really large and comfortable and quiet. We enjoyed the pool area every day, the pool was large and warm, and the surroundings were pretty. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and you can place meal orders to have outside by the pool. The staff at this Starbucks/snack bar were excellent. There is a good business centre right in the main lobby, and lots of comfortable seating, both indoors and out in the courtyard. There is a trolley bus stop outside the hotel to get up and down the main street. Nice hotel, but wish it had closer beach access.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

reviews.text: We stayed here pre-cruise and we were very pleased. We arrived early in the morning and the staff was very helpful in getting us an early checkin so that we didnt have to wait in the lobby. Will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Hotel is nice but Cocoa Beach has limited activites

reviews.text: Upon arrival, I was asked if it was business or pleasure. When I told the desk clerk pleasure, there was no follow up. I had to discover "perks" about the hotel on my own. I liked the Guest Guide padfolio provided in the room, I am a big fan of technology, but did not like the GoBoard. It had too much information on one screen that only one person at a time could manipulate. An app or 3 mini kiosk would've been better. It wasn't until half way through my trip, that I came upon the Traveler Information Center by the vending machine. Why is this not by the GoBoard? I loved the Cocoa Beach map and would've appreciated receiving this when the desk clerk learned I was there for pleasure. There is a section of the Business Center called "Boarding Pass" with two computers that only do flight check ins! Pretty cool! The walk to the beach from exit door to sand is 3 minutes max! Signage is minimal, so my advice is to exit by the Meeting Rooms, not the pool. There is not much to do in Cocoa Beach, but I really liked that I had multiple dining options within walking distance! The hotel is clean and quiet. The spa tub in the Spa room is divine! The jets are powerful and provide a great massage! "Vacation" in Orlando, Relax at Courtyard Cocoa Beach!
reviews.title: Pre-Cruise Stay

reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful. Clean & comfy, great pool, amazing staff and a very short walk to the beach and shops and restaurants. The ladies that run breakfast are always smiling. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel and fantastic staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My question,is, "Why are there no upscale hotels on Cocoa Beach?" Now this one is good. It has only two negatives Beach access and small vanity areas. For an average priced hotel in this area the amenities are great.Free Parking, free wi-fi and open computers to use, a beautiful sitting and dining area with booths with their own DirecTV remote and flat screen tv's, good service and a very helpful staff. Now the beach access which it shares with the Hampton Inn next door is convenient but it is a long winding trail of about 1/4 mile, it is lighted at night but it is long when it is hot and when you walk back up it is uphill all the way. The pool is big, and there is a Jacuzzi which I reveled in and a lot of seating on the deck. It even has a fire pit! for cooler nights. I found the bathroom and vanity areas too small. but the rest of the hotel makes up for it. The food in their bistro area is very very good but a little high. For a hotel that really isn't upscale in an area where upscale is a foreign word, this one is really worth the moderate price.. Oh here is a very important component, one of the best mattresses I ever slept on away from home. and the pillows were cushiony and comfortable. So sleep wise a great deal.
reviews.title: The strange case of Cocoa Beach

reviews.text: This is your typical Marriott Courtyard with the quality, service, and amenities you'd expect. It has a nice pool, a quiet dining area off the lobby, and fairly spacious rooms.
reviews.title: Close yet quiet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can easily walk to the attractions of Cocoa Beach (which are limited to souvenir shops, the beach, and some restaurants). There is plenty of free parking at the hotel--you will need a car to get around.
reviews.title: Unforgettable weekend, great bartender.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel caters to vacationers and business travelers, alike. There are several computers available for guests, a food kiosk (no table service), and an exercise room. The location is great if you don't want the activity level of the town center but want to be close enough to walk.
reviews.title: Not disappointed!

reviews.text: We had 2 rooms which were connected. Nice rooms & private balcony. Great for watching the July 4th fireworks on the beach. I didn't like the fact that the sink & vanity were outside the bathroom. It makes for noise & lights while my husband slept. We had a king suite, which they said was ocean front & one of the nicest rooms on property. It's not oceanfront. We were on the 5th floor above the treetops. There is a private path to get to the beach, but my husband has several disabilities, one with breathing & he would have never made it. Once on the beach you could rent a lounge chair for $10 even for a couple hours, 2 chairs & beach umbrella for $49.. I was told no discounts as it was a holiday weekend. There were no umbrellas to rent so settled on lounge chairs. The pool towels @ the hotel are really little, so if possible bring your own beach towels. The pool area was nice. The hotel lobby was modern & plenty of seating. Starbucks isn't a "real" Starbucks they just brew their coffee & can't make any special drinks. Breakfast was expensive, should provide a continental breakfast for free or minimal charge. It makes it so convenient. Very difficult to get luggage carts. We waited about 45mins for checkout cart. I called the front desk 3 times. My grandchildren ages 6, 4 & 8 months were getting very impatient, as you can imagine.
reviews.title: Nice but not directly on the beach.

reviews.text: Was there from July 1 - July 6 2013 for a family vacation. Hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. Kim, the bartender at the Tiki bar was outstanding, very nice personality and a great job mixing the drinks!! Kim was very helpful on suggesting local restaurants to go to. I would definitetly stay at the Courtyard again.
reviews.title: Fourth of July Week Stay 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Considering the price, the amenities, and the proximity to the beach, this is a very good place. The property is not right on the beach, but is a short walk down a private path to the beach. The lobby and reception areas are brand new, however the rooms are definitely in need of updating as the bedding is not up to the standard of more modern Marriott properties and the air conditioner is really old fashioned. However, on the positive side, the rooms are large and we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite, which was appreciated.The pool area is fine, but showing its age. Service is friendly and efficient, from check-in to housekeeping.
reviews.title: Very Good for What It Is

reviews.text: Had a great stay. Everyone was super nice. Kim at the Tiki Bar was the best!!! I will definitely be coming back!! I have been to Florida many times for years visiting family and friends on the West Coast. Th
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: After a horrific experience at another hotel in cocoa beach, we were tempted to end our vacation early and head back home to St. Augustine. That is until we stepped into the lobby of the Courtyard Marriott in Cocoa Beach on the afternoon of Saturday, July 6. We were immediately greeted by Justine at the front desk who was very gracious and accommodating! Even though they were busy, she took the time to show us a room they had available for the night. It was clean, spacious & had a jacuzzi in the room--it was exactly what we were looking for. We were able to check-in immediately and she gave us some excellent suggestions on places to eat & things to do in the area. I'm sure Marriott is very thankful to have Justine working for them. This hotel is located on the beach and is a beautiful setting for a romantic getaway. It also has a cafe in the lobby that brews Starbucks coffee which is a huge plus. Kim, the bartender at the Tiki Bar was also great! We enjoyed pina coladas while relaxing in their non-chlorine, mineral pool. Overall, our stay here was perfect and we will definitely be back. Thank you for saving our trip!
reviews.title: Excellent service!

aka: Courtyard Cocoa Beach Hotel Cocoa Beach
description: The new state-of-the-art lobby at Courtyard by Marriott Cocoa Beach-Cape Canaveral provides greater flexibility and choices for our guests. This hotel features our new lobby with inviting, flexible spaces to work or relax in, free Wi-Fi throughout and easy access to the latest news, weather and airport conditions via our GoBoard™. The highlight of our new lobby experience is The Bistro - Eat. Drink. Connect.™ which provides guests with healthy food and Starbucks in the morning as well as lunch and evening dinner service with cocktails. Located on famous Cocoa Beach, 200 yards from the Atlantic Ocean and just minutes from Port Canaveral Cruises, Kennedy Space Center, Historic Cocoa Village, and Orlando's Attractions. We offer a well equipped fitness center, mineral pool and whirlpool. A 24-hour business center and boarding pass printing service is also available. Your stay at Courtyard Cocoa Beach/Cape Canaveral is sure to be more comfortable, more productive and more enjoyable than ever before!
